results.title: Sales & Reporting Analyst
results.description:
Position

Sales & Reporting Analyst

Location

Burlington, MA or remote within New England


About LightForce

LightForce is a 3D printing technology company focused on the orthodontic space. Our digital platform empowers orthodontists with 3D-printed tooth-moving tools. In 2019, we launched our first product - the world's only, fully customized 3D printed bracket system and digital treatment software. We are proud to be one of the fastest growing companies in the industry. Learn more at: www.lf.co

Description

The Analyst will report to the Senior Director of Commercial Operations. This individual will improve, execute, and effectively communicate significant analyses that identify meaningful trends and opportunities across the business. The Analyst will participate in regular meetings with management, assessing and addressing issues to identify and implement improvements toward efficient operations.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Prepare, analyze, and summarize various weekly, monthly, and periodic operational results for use by various key stakeholders, creating reports, specifications, instructions, and flowcharts
  • Provide strong and timely financial and business analytic decision support to business partners and various organizational stakeholders
  • Evaluate key performance indicators, provide ongoing reports, and recommend business plan updates
  • Interpret data, analyze results using analytics, research methodologies, and statistical techniques
  • Develop and implement data analyses, leverage data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Conduct full lifecycle of analytics projects, including pulling, manipulating, and exporting data from project requirements documentation to design and execution

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree, preferably in computer science, mathematics, business management, or economics
  • Minimum of 3+ years' experience
  • Deep experience with managing budgets
  • The ability to present findings in a polished way
  • Proficiency with statistics and dataset analytics (using SPSS, SAS, Excel)
  • Entrepreneurial mindset, with an innovative approach to business planning
  • Valid Driver's license and ability to travel

Attributes

  • Strong work ethic
  • Advanced analytical skills with experience collecting, organizing, analyzing, and disseminating abundant information with accuracy
  • The ability to write reports
  • Exceptional verbal, written, and visual communication skills


Work Schedule/Hours

  • Regular business hours


Physical Demands

  • While performing the essential functions of this job, an individual is regularly required to sit or stand, walk, travel (vehicle and plane), see, use hands and arms, listen, and speak.

Perks

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Generous premium coverage for medical, dental, and vision plans
  • Fitness and wellness reimbursement program
  • Retirement account
  • Pre-tax commuter benefits program
  • Paid parental leave

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company and we are most interested in finding the BEST candidate for the job. We would strongly encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of the preferred qualifications described.

LightForce has a Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, which requires team members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or be approved for a medical or religious exemption with accommodations in order to partake in certain activities in the United States.

LightForce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, Protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law

results.title: Inside Sales
results.description:
Company Description

Where do you find your local community news? How do you stay connected to new and old businesses in your community? Metroland Media is a communication company built on a strong history of providing the news to Ontario’s door steps for over 100 years. In this ever growing industry we have continued to evolve, allowing us to become the industry leaders. Flyers, magazines, trade shows, digital advertising and distribution is a snapshot of our companies breadth. If you are looking for a dynamic company built on a strong history within your community, look no further.

Our Commitment To Diversity
We strive to be a leader in building and cultivating an employee community framed around fairness, support and opportunity. We believe that what makes us different, makes a difference. And as a team, the diversity of our backgrounds, interests and experiences is what enriches our work, and our workplaces. We welcome all, and we strive for an inclusive culture that allows individual growth and shared success.



Job Description

Identifying a new opportunity through an ongoing trend to provide marketing opportunities to our clients in a more online and virtual way, we are creating a new high-performance virtual Inside Sales team to work solely from their home office.  We are currently searching for elite selling professionals to join this new team.

We are a looking for highly motivated, self-starters that understand customer-need based, consultative selling and can develop business prospects from multiple sources.  If you are an organized, persistent, and driven sales professional that thrives in a fast-paced environment while working exclusively from home, this role is for you.

The successful candidates will be responsible for prospecting, qualifying and generating sales revenue for both print and digital products across select Community markets. Individuals will have the ability to grow existing business, reestablish client relationships and initiate new business using industry leading sales support technologies.

This is an amazing opportunity for anyone interested in being able to work remotely from their home, anywhere in Ontario

 KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Working from home developing sales via telephone, virtual and email communications
  • Follow up on inbound leads in line with established expected Service Levels
  • Manage targeted client and prospect lead list and a high volume of client accounts.
  • Conduct a needs analysis to help identify budgets and needs to recommend appropriate  product selections for clients.
  • Work daily with sales tools including CRM and Sales Engagement Platform
  • Build and cultivate client relationships by initiating communications and conducting follow-up communications in order to move opportunities through the sales funnel.
  • Track sales pipeline to consistently meet monthly revenue and client acquisition goals.
  • As part of this role, you will be required to handle credit card information. Metroland Media  is a PCI compliant company and requires people in this role to take PCI training to handle cards in a safe and compliant manner.



Qualifications
  • Minimum 1 -3 years of sales experience.  Print and digital media experience an asset.
  • Creative thinker that has a professional, positive and enthusiastic attitude
  • Demonstrated ability to meet and/or exceed determined sales and activity quotas
  • An expert at getting to the Right Party Contact
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Comfortable in using Sales Support digital technology including a CRM system.
  • Highly self-motivated and accountable



Additional Information

AODA
Metroland is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment process ensuring equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code we will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify the hiring manager upon scheduling the interview of your requirements.

results.title: Sales Development Representative
results.description:
We believe in the power of process and its potential to unlock growth in teams everywhere.

Who We Are:

Process Street is a no-code workflow platform startup from San Francisco. We help our customers build, document, automate, and track recurring workflows. Our platform stores knowledge where the action happens, ensuring thorough and error free execution of workflows that our global customers run their businesses on. We service over 3k customers around the world, such as Airbnb, Spotify, AstraZeneca, and Accenture, and are VC-backed by Accel, Salesforce, and Atlassian.

Our Mission:

To make recurring work fun, fast, and faultless for teams everywhere.

Our Culture:

Process Street was founded on a strong belief in the work-life benefits of a healthy, collaborative remote culture. We value flexibility because many of us are parents, travelers, or just creatives who aren't inspired by the construct of a mundane 9-to-5. Spread across 9 different time zones, we communicate asynchronously, work autonomously, and take real ownership of our work. We know human connections are what make teams strong, so we regularly do coffee chats, game-playing, story-telling, and more, to build strong relationships.

If you’re entrepreneurial and seek an environment that values impact, ownership, and flexibility we look forward to meeting you! 

The Opportunity:

The Sales Development Representative is an exciting commercial development opportunity that will report into our Director of Sales. You’ll play a pivotal role as the first point of contact for new customer leads by adding a personalized touch to engage with our potential new customers; utilizing various modes of communication (chat, email, phone, video, and social media).

In this role, you will partner with Account Executives and Relationship Managers to identify opportunities for improving our team’s customer conversion rate. Strong collaboration and relationship building skills are a must, as this role involves working with diverse stakeholders across multiple teams. 

As an SDR you’ll have the opportunity for professional progression into other functional areas within the Sales & Marketing Teams. 

For this position, we are looking for someone located in Pacific, Mountain, or Central time zones.

What You’ll Do:

  • Follow up with leads via chat, email, phone, video, and social media
  • Research target accounts and perform outreach through emails, calls, and social media
  • Perform minor discovery to identify the needs and scale of an opportunity
  • Schedule qualified opportunities with our Account Executives
  • Research and personalize communications to high-value leads
  • Design systems to better improve your funnels and performance

What You Bring to the Table:

  • A sharp and hungry mindset, with pure excitement for a career in SaaS Sales
  • A natural knack for learning new technology
  • A solid understanding of SaaS business models with strong business acumen
  • A growth mentality - you have a self motivated approach to learning and development
  • A natural intellectual curiosity coupled with resolute grit
  • Excellent communicator, both written and verbal

Our Fav[ou]rite Perks:

  • Unlimited PTO policy – Most take 3-4 weeks, plus their major holidays, AND a company-wide week off in December.
  • Annual company offsite - We are excited for our global team retreat in Portugal in Fall of 2022. We also encourage and sponsor small group meetups so that you can meet your teammates face to face around the world throughout the year.
  • Social time – We know human connections are what make teams strong. We regularly do coffee chats, game-playing, story-telling, house tours (only if you're comfortable), and more to build connections.
  • Generous health insurance for US employees and their families, including dental and vision plans.
  • Equity for all full-time roles.

Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But we'll let you in on a secret: there's no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. Research tells us that applicants who are female, non-binary, or people of color are less likely to apply to a role if they feel they don’t meet every qualification. If you feel you meet most of the qualifications, regardless of how you identify, and this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day, please apply! Process Street is a place where everyone can grow.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, genetic information, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status.

results.title: Methodiq Sales Development Representative
results.description:
Methodiq powers the digital transformation of diagnostic laboratories, bringing them into the modern era and allowing them better IT operations to secure more revenue. Our team was built by highly experienced lab experts and engineers who have over 25 years of technical expertise to build solutions specific to this healthcare niche.  

 

We're looking for an SDR that will help us drive success through our digital engineering arm, while leading us through the next chapter of our rapidly expanding business. Alternatively, should you be both sales-savvy and technically knowledgeable with ample experience in the laboratory sphere, we are open to hiring a Senior VP of Sales. 

 

The right individual will be self-driven and excited to help build a world-class sales culture from the ground up. Our sales and marketing teams have worked harmoniously together, but lack a structural framework that will allow us to meet the incredible demands of our niche industry. Methodiq (in conjunction with sister-company Gistia) continues to offer expanded services and a unique product portfolio, furthering a myriad of future opportunities should we cultivate a team capable of securing them. 

 

About you: 

You aspire to lead and build; to grow beyond your current role: 

  • You are responsible for pipeline generation 
  • Your goal is to proactively build new relationships with individuals in our target demographic (laboratory management) 
  • You have an opinion on sales methodology, how to do discovery, and what to say to customers 
  • You'll utilize “Account Based Marketing” sales strategies, and some unique to you 
  • You'll have experience in healthcare, ideally laboratories; live and breathe their language 
  • Drive outreach activity to secure remote and in-person meetings and demonstrations 
  • You'll continually develop, improve and populate our core outreach cadences in collaboration with our Marketing team 
  • You will establish new business relationships via telephone, email, social media, networking events and content collaborations 
  • You will qualify inbound leads (MQL) to ensure quality leads are passed over to the commercial team 
  • You will maintain and police CRM accuracy  
  • You'll utilize Hubspot and Linkedin (as well as others) to grow our CRM within our defined target audience 
  • You'll be the one to steward MQLs through appropriate cadence activity 
  • You are the HUNTER in our sales process:

What you don't need to be: 

  • An expert in software development, data, machine learning or deeply technical (though we will bring you up-to-speed in what you'll need to know) 
  • A sales operations leader 
  • A contracts or legal expert

results.title: Sales Representative
results.description:
About Ergeon

We are disrupting the trillion-dollar construction industry with technology, making it possible for almost any profession to operate remotely. Our company is the only startup combining the strengths of technology and remote work to solve the challenges of residential construction. 

Unlike most other products and services, hiring a contractor for a home improvement project is very far from a 1-click experience today. Ergeon aims to empower skilled local contractors with human and technology-powered services to make home improvement easy. We take a full-stack approach to create a seamless experience for homeowners, and leverage technology to scale the front & back offices of contractors.

With the belief that everyone has a right to professional growth and respect regardless of their location, we proudly have staff (aka Ergeoneers) in dozens of countries, with a great score and recommendation rating on Glassdoor.  Come join us to make construction friendly and accessible!

 

Ergeon: [er - g- eon]

Erg = unit of work or energy

Eon = billion years

 

Ergeon is founded by CS Ph.D. serial entrepreneurs Jiayue (Jenny) He and Odysseas Tstatalos. They picked this name to symbolize their joint passion for using tech to revolutionize work. 

 
Overview of the Role

The Customer Specialist role is a transitional phase to  the Senior Customer Specialist role, meaning that if you do well, you’ll have the opportunity to build a sales career path in the company. Once you have built a strong customer portfolio and proven a successful track record, you will opt for a performance review to get promoted to the Senior Customer Specialist role.


As a Customer Specialist, you will be the voice of Ergeon to new leads interested in our home services products. From first conversations to closing the deals, you will support Ergeon’s growth by walking customers through a high-touch, customer-oriented sales experience approach. Whether getting to know the lead’s needs, quoting and closing a project, or sharing Ergeon’s value proposition, you will be focused on listening and creating the best customer experience above all else.

 
Responsibilities

As a Customer Specialist at Ergeon a typical day will include the following:

  • Managing open deals (leads).
  • Communicating with leads via inbound calls, emails, and text messages.
  • Making outbound calls to qualify new customers.
  • Handling leads from qualification, to quoted and closed stages through single touch point interactions (end to end sales cycle). When not possible, you will need to set the appropriate follow up activities.
  • Managing your customer pipeline through the usage of CRMs and other various tools.
  • Sending quotes, clarifying questions, and closing deals to drive the Company’s revenue.
  • Using your sales expertise to mentor Junior Customer Specialists.
 
Desired Skills and Experience
Must have
  • 3+ years of advanced experience in B2C and/or B2B Sales
  • Strong communication, customer rapport building and closing skills.
  • Ability to master new products and concepts quickly.
  • Proven track record of end-to-end pipeline management and achieving monthly revenue targets.
  • Ability to define and refine new sales processes.
  • Attention to detail, organization and prioritization skills.
  • Time management and discipline.
  • Sense of urgency and multitasking skills.
  • Being able to handle high work volume efficiently.
  • Proven track record of closing deals, metric compliance and proficiency on multi stage end-to-end sales cycles.
  • Proficiency and fluency in English (business etiquette).
  • Ability to work under pressure and dynamic target environments.
  • Experience using pipeline management or productivity tools like Pipedrive, Talkdesk, or Front among others.
  • Previous full-time remote work experience.
Nice to have
  • Sales experience in general labor or construction industry.
  • Sales leadership and management experience.

 

Technical Requirements

Good Laptop setup with Chrome browser

  • Minimum of 8GB RAM
  • Minimum processor:
    • For Intel variants of CPUs:
      • Core i3 8000 Series (8th Gen) or higher
      • Pentium N5000 series (Quad-core variant) or higher
      • Celeron J5000 series or higher (quad-core variant)
    • For AMD variants of CPUs:
      • Ryzen 3, 3rd generation or higher

 

Stable high-speed internet connection

  • At least 5mbps upload and 20 Mbps download

 

Headset

  • With a noise cancelling microphone

 

Power backup

  • 250-300W UPS

 

Data availability

  • Ability to access up to 1.5GB of data per day during storm outages
 
Compensation

Monthly salary between $1.200 - $1.500 USD + Commissions.

  • Commissions are based on a tier model that accounts for the revenue that you bring to the company.
  • Your final compensation will depend on your placement on our Career Ladder and will be calculated hourly.
  • You'll be paid weekly through Upwork (www.upwork.com), the platform we choose to hire and pay our Ergeoneers all over the world.
 
Additional important information
Bootcamp
  • World-class Sales Training of 4 weeks including: 1-1 sessions, constant mentoring, teamwork, practical use and understanding of our technical tools, and live exercises to develop abilities.
  • You are going to be able to do a full immersion in the day-to-day job, enjoy our amazing company culture, make great friends, and learn a lot!
  • We are completely convinced that this period gives you the opportunity to decide if the job and the company are your perfect match, and it also helps us to know you better.
Availability
  • The position is full-time, based on a 40 hours week.
  • Availability Monday through Sunday from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM PST/CST/EST.
  • The expectation is to cover at least 40 scheduled hours that fall on any of the days mentioned above.
  • Most commonly this will mean working 4 days of the week + 1 weekend day.
 
Ergeon’s benefits and perks for full staff members

Competitive compensation: We invest in people! We are constantly doing worldwide market research in order to offer globally competitive salaries. And we are well funded by VCs.

  All-Remote since the beginning: We have a diverse team spread across 40+ countries. We stay connected through the best remote work practices such as flexible work hours, team events, remote happy hours, and by sharing our love of food!

    Tech, Wellness & Learning fund: You can have a $400USD bonus per year for software and hardware tools, workplace improvements, fitness-related spending (includes things like yoga classes, Fitbit tracker, new running shoes, gym membership. . .), and books, courses, training, or even attending conferences.

  Stock options: All staff is eligible after 6 months of full-time work.

  Birthday Paid day off: You can take the exact day, or Friday before if it is on a weekend!

  Flexible Paid time off: You can take 12 days after working 6 months, PLUS 2 extra days per year for a maximum of 20 days.

  Free Headset Benefit: You can get a noise-canceling headset since your first day working full-time.

  Equipment: Laptop replacement after 1 year of full-time work. And every 3 years after that.

   Co-Working Fund: Meet in groups of 3+ Ergeon friends and get reimbursed up to USD $20 for coffee, co-working, etc (once per quarter).

  Language Classes: here at Ergeon you will have the opportunity to learn or improve a language!

 

We believe everyone has a right to professional growth and respect, no matter their location.

Ergeon’s workforce is given meaningful opportunities and is supported by a kind and diverse community.

Our global staff (Ergeoneers) have access to career growth, amazing work culture, and great benefits.

Come join us to transform the construction industry!
